title: rustc SIGSEGV in WSL after upgrade to 1.66.0 stable
body:
After running `rustup update` inside my WSL shell on Windows 10 (Ubuntu 20.04 LTS), I tried to use the Rust compiler. ```rust $ cargo new --lib hello Created library `hello` package $ cd hello $ cargo check error: failed to run `rustc` to learn about target-specific information Caused by: process didn't exit successfully: `rustc - --crate-name ___ --print=file-names --crate-type bin --crate-type rlib --crate-type dylib --crate-type cdylib --crate-type staticlib --crate-type proc-macro --print=sysroot --print=cfg` (signal: 11, SIGSEGV: invalid memory reference) --- stderr /home/tk/.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/librustc_driver-105dc47ffbb49418.so(+0x30e23e3)[0x7eff7e78b3e3] /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0(+0x14420)[0x7eff7b4f8420] /home/tk/.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/librustc_driver-105dc47ffbb49418.so(+0x19ccfcc)[0x7eff7d075fcc] $ ``` I have the log from the update - it was from 1.65 (which was previously working fine) to 1.66: ``` $ rustup update info: syncing channel updates for 'stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu' info: latest update on 2022-12-15, rust version 1.66.0 (69f9c33d7 2022-12-12) info: downloading component 'rust-src' info: downloading component 'cargo' info: downloading component 'clippy' info: downloading component 'rust-docs' info: downloading component 'rust-std' 29.7 MiB / 29.7 MiB (100 %) 14.1 MiB/s in 2s ETA: 0s info: downloading component 'rustc' 68.0 MiB / 68.0 MiB (100 %) 20.6 MiB/s in 3s ETA: 0s info: downloading component 'rustfmt' info: removing previous version of component 'rust-src' info: removing previous version of component 'cargo' info: removing previous version of component 'clippy' info: removing previous version of component 'rust-docs' info: removing previous version of component 'rust-std' info: removing previous version of component 'rustc' info: removing previous version of component 'rustfmt' info: installing component 'rust-src' info: installing component 'cargo' info: installing component 'clippy' info: installing component 'rust-docs' 19.0 MiB / 19.0 MiB (100 %) 8.1 MiB/s in 1s ETA: 0s info: installing component 'rust-std' 29.7 MiB / 29.7 MiB (100 %) 13.0 MiB/s in 2s ETA: 0s info: installing component 'rustc' 68.0 MiB / 68.0 MiB (100 %) 14.8 MiB/s in 4s ETA: 0s info: installing component 'rustfmt' info: checking for self-updates stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu updated - rustc 1.66.0 (69f9c33d7 2022-12-12) (from rustc 1.65.0 (897e37553 2022-11-02)) info: cleaning up downloads & tmp directories $ ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.66.0 (69f9c33d7 2022-12-12) binary: rustc commit-hash: 69f9c33d71c871fc16ac445211281c6e7a340943 commit-date: 2022-12-12 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.66.0 LLVM version: 15.0.2 ```
LLDB run with more detailed backtrace

``` (lldb) process launch -- - --crate-name ___ --print=file-names --crate-type bin --crate-type rlib --crate-type dylib --crate-type cdylib --crate-type staticlib --crate-type proc-macro --print=sysroot --print=cfg There is a running process, kill it and restart?: [Y/n] Y Process 960 exited with status = 9 (0x00000009) Process 970 launched: '/home/tk/.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/bin/rustc' (x86_64) Process 970 stopped * thread #1, name = 'rustc', stop reason = signal SIGSEGV: invalid address (fault address: 0x0) frame #0: 0x00007ffff587bfcc librustc_driver-105dc47ffbb49418.so`_RNvXsf_NtCsjYmB6e7O6yL_21rustc_data_structures13stable_hasherSNtNtCs2nE6X61r04u_12rustc_middle3mir9StatementINtB5_10HashStableNtNtNtCs4nHVQ99sVkF_18rustc_query_system3ich3hcx20StableHashingContextE11hash_stableCscVLlLUGm5ew_16rustc_query_impl + 5484 librustc_driver-105dc47ffbb49418.so`_RNvXsf_NtCsjYmB6e7O6yL_21rustc_data_structures13stable_hasherSNtNtCs2nE6X61r04u_12rustc_middle3mir9StatementINtB5_10HashStableNtNtNtCs4nHVQ99sVkF_18rustc_query_system3ich3hcx20StableHashingContextE11hash_stableCscVLlLUGm5ew_16rustc_query_impl: -> 0x7ffff587bfcc <+5484>: addb %al, (%rax) 0x7ffff587bfce <+5486>: addb %al, (%rax) 0x7ffff587bfd0 <+5488>: addb %al, (%rax) 0x7ffff587bfd2 <+5490>: addb %al, (%rax) (lldb) bt * thread #1, name = 'rustc', stop reason = signal SIGSEGV: invalid address (fault address: 0x0) * frame #0: 0x00007ffff587bfcc librustc_driver-105dc47ffbb49418.so`_RNvXsf_NtCsjYmB6e7O6yL_21rustc_data_structures13stable_hasherSNtNtCs2nE6X61r04u_12rustc_middle3mir9StatementINtB5_10HashStableNtNtNtCs4nHVQ99sVkF_18rustc_query_system3ich3hcx20StableHashingContextE11hash_stableCscVLlLUGm5ew_16rustc_query_impl + 5484 ```
